intro: Acer italum f. hispanicum, commonly known as the Spanish maple, is a variant of the Italian maple native to southern Europe. It is a deciduous tree that typically grows to a height of 10–15 meters, featuring a broad, rounded crown. The leaves are palmately lobed, with a serrated margin and a dark green upper surface. It produces small, yellowish-green flowers in early spring, followed by winged samaras as its fruit. This plant thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas across its native range.
